summary: The document is a classified communication detailing the operational procedures for a covert operation under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992. It focuses on establishing secure communication with an agent, utilizing special supplies such as carbon sheets and developer pills for invisible writing. The document underscores the necessity of training the agent in secure communication methods and the meticulous management of operational materials to ensure secrecy.
key_findings: Establishing two-way secure correspondence with an agent using special supplies.
Instructions for the agent on the proper handling and storage of communication materials to prevent accidental loss.
Procedures for developing and dispatching secure messages, including the utilization of accommodation addresses in Latin American countries.
Guidance on conducting training sessions for the agent, highlighting the preference for multiple short sessions rather than a single lengthy one.
Recommendations for generating cover correspondence to separate the agent's identity from secure reports.
Specific supplies and instructions provided for the operation, including developer materials and practice messages.
